intro: Stillingia multiramea, commonly known as the redstem stellaria, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland environments and has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is known for its adaptability to various soil types. Stillingia multiramea is often found in shaded areas and can spread through rhizomes, forming dense mats.
